Load the packages that we wil use.
```{r}
library(ggplot2)
library(tidyr)
library(dplyr)
library(magrittr)
library(readr)
library(tidyverse)
library(ggfortify)
library(cowplot)
```

Embed plots, for example:

```{r}
# read in the raw data
data <- read_csv("data/data_dev_stages.csv")

data_field <- read_csv("data/field_data_short.csv")

qc <- read_csv("data/qc.csv")

qc_long <- qc %>%
  gather(metabolite, intensity, -pool_id) %>%
  separate(pool_id, c("to_delete", "pool_id"), sep = "_") %>%
  select(pool_id, metabolite, intensity)

# create some new variables
  # different developmental stages groups

data <- data %>%
  mutate(dev_group = ifelse(dev_stage > 3 & dev_stage < 7, "4-6",
                     ifelse(dev_stage > 7 & dev_stage < 10, "7-9", ">9")))

# sums of different classes of lipids 

data <- data %>%
  mutate(LPCs = rowSums(data[,57:62])) %>%
  mutate(PCs = rowSums(data[,76:101])) %>%
  mutate(PEs = rowSums(data[,102:112])) %>%
  mutate(PGs = rowSums(data[,113:120])) %>%
  mutate(SQDGs = rowSums(data[,129:135])) %>%
  mutate(TGs = rowSums(data[,136:187])) %>%
  mutate(DGs = rowSums(data[,25:52])) %>%
  mutate(MGDGs = rowSums(data[,63:74])) 

# ratios
  
data <- data %>%
  mutate(PCLPC = PCs/LPCs) %>%
  mutate(PELPC = PEs/LPCs) %>%
  mutate(PEPC = PEs/PCs)

data <- data[, c(1:16, 25:199)]

# make long data frame.

data_long <- data %>%
  gather(metabolite, intensity, -sample_id, -genotype, -block_number, -replica_number, -dev_stage, -dev_group, -leaf_number, -leaf_zone, -dag, -tissue_designation, -developmental_stage_dap, -dev_group)

write_csv(data_long,"output/data_long.csv")


# now letÂ´s plot some of of summary data
# this is how you do it for one single variable

data_leaf_zones <- data %>%
  filter(leaf_zone != "Along") %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = leaf_zone, y = PCLPC, colour = genotype)) +
  geom_jitter(width = 0.25) +
  ggtitle("PCLPC") +
  ggsave("output/SQDG_42_1_16_0_16_0.pdf")    


data %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = PCs, y = LPCs, colour = genotype)) +
  geom_point() +
  facet_grid(.~genotype) +
  ggtitle("PCs-LPCs") +
  ggsave("output/PCs-LPCs.pdf")    

```

# we first create a new data frame just with the numerical values

pca_data <- data[, c(11:178)]
